<TR style="HEIGHT: 0.5in">
<TD style="HEIGHT: 0.5in; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" width="100%" colSpan=5>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-serif">(*) The 
probable scenario was computed based on the following risks: oil and oil 
products prices: fair value on June 30, 2016; R$ x U.S. Dollar - a 4.4% 
depreciation of the Real; Japanese Yen x U.S. Dollar - a 0.2% depreciation of 
the Japanese Yen; Peso x U.S. Dollar - a 0.3% depreciation of the Peso; LIBOR 
Forward Curve - a 0.02% increase throughout the curve. </FONT><FONT style="FONT-
SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-serif">Source: Focus and 
Bloomberg.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR style="HEIGHT: 12.75pt">
<TD style="HEIGHT: 12.75pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="34%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT style="FONT-
SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 12.75pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="36%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT style="FONT-
SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 12.75pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="10%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT style="FONT-
SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 12.75pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="10%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT style="FONT-
SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 12.75pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="10%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT style="FONT-
SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; 
BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=red 
face=Calibri,sans-serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=#548dd4 face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>31.1.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Risk management of price risk 
(related to crude oil and oil products prices)</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Petrobras does not regularly use
derivative instruments to hedge exposures to commodity price cycles related to 
products purchased and sold to fulfill operational needs. Derivatives are used 
as hedging instruments to manage the price risk of certain short-term commercial
transactions.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>31.2.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Foreign exchange risk 
management</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Petrobras seeks to identify and 
manage foreign exchange rate risks based on an integrated analysis of its 
businesses with the benefits of diversification. The Company&#8217;s short-term 
risk management involves choosing the currency in which to hold cash, such as 
the Brazilian Real, U.S. dollar or other currency. The foreign exchange risk 
management strategy may involve the use of derivative financial instruments to 
hedge certain liabilities, minimizing foreign exchange rate risk 
exposure.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>a)</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 7pt" 
face="times new 
roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif>Cash Flow Hedge involving the Company&#8217;s&nbsp; future 
exports</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>The Company designates hedging 
relationships to account for the effects of the existing hedge between a portion
of its long-term debt obligations (denominated in U.S. dollars) and its highly 
probable U.S. dollar denominated future export revenues, so that gains or losses
associated with the hedged transaction (the highly probable future exports) and 
the hedging instrument (debt obligations) are recognized in the statement of 
income in the same periods.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>A portion of principal amounts 
and accrued interest (non-derivative financial instruments), as well as foreign 
exchange rate forward contracts (derivative financial instruments) have been 
designated as hedging instruments. Derivative financial instruments expired 
during the year were replaced by principal and interest amounts in the hedging 
relationships for which they had been designated.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Individual hedging relationships
were designated in a one-to-one proportion, meaning that a portion of the highly
probable future exports for each month will be the hedged transaction of an 
individual hedging relationship, hedged by a portion of the company&#8217;s 
long-term debt. Only a portion of the Company&#8217;s forecast exports are 
considered highly probable.</FONT></P>
<a name="_bclFooter50"></a><DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=center><FONT 
style="DISPLAY: none" face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE:
11pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT 
lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif>50</FONT></FONT><FONT
face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT style="DISPLAY: none"><FONT lang=PT-BR 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT></FONT><FONT 
face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></P></DIV></DIV>
<HR align=center SIZE=2 width="100%" noShade>
<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&nbsp;</DIV>
&nbsp; <A name="page_51"></A>
<DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 0%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%">
<a name="_bclHeader51"></a><DIV>
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><B><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 14pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>Petr&#243;leo Brasileiro S.A. &#8211; 
Petrobras</FONT></B></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>Notes to the financial statements</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT><I><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"
face=Calibri,sans-serif>(Expressed in millions of US Dollars, unless otherwise 
indicated)</FONT></I></FONT></P>
<DIV style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0in; 
BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-RIGHT: 0in">
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0in; MARGIN: 
0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-RIGHT: 0in"><FONT><FONT lang=EN-
US style="FONT-SIZE: 5pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P></DIV></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Whenever a portion of future 
exports for a certain period for which a hedging relationship has been 
designated is no longer highly probable, the Company revokes the designation and
the cumulative foreign exchange gains or losses that have been recognized in 
other comprehensive income remain separately in equity until the forecast 
exports occur.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>If a portion of future exports 
for which a hedging relationship has been designated is no longer expected to 
occur, any related cumulative foreign exchange gains or losses that have been 
recognized in other comprehensive income from the date the hedging relationship 
was designated to the date the Company revoked the designation is immediately 
recycled from equity to the statement of income.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Mainly due to the decrease in 
international oil prices, a portion of future exports for which a hedging 
relationship had been designated was no longer expected to occur or did not 
occur in the first half of 2016. Therefore, hedging relationship was revoked and
a portion was reclassified to the statement of income in amount of US$&nbsp;292 
in the first half of 2016.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>The carrying amounts, the fair 
value as of June 30, 2016, and a schedule of expected reclassifications to the 
statement of income of cumulative losses recognized in other comprehensive 
income (shareholders&#8217; equity) based on a US$ 1.00 / R$ 3.2098 exchange 
rate are set out below:</FONT></P>

serif">61,520</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.45pt; BORDER-BOTTOM: #008542 1pt solid; PADDING-BOTTOM:
0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom 
width="13%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" 
align=right><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-

LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="11%">
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
color=black face=arial,sans-serif></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=#548dd4 face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; 
BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=red 
face=Calibri,sans-serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=#548dd4 face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Additional hedging relationships
may be revoked or additional reclassification adjustments from equity to the 
statement of income may occur as a result of changes in forecast export prices 
and export volumes following a review in the Company&#8217;s business plan. 
Based on a sensitivity analysis considering a US$ 10/barrel decrease in Brent 
prices stress scenario, when compared to the Brent price projections in our most
recent update of the 2015-2019 Business and Management Plan (</FONT><I><FONT 
lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Plano de 
Neg&#243;cios e Gest&#227;o </FONT></I><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt"
face=Calibri,sans-serif>&#8211; </FONT><I><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>PNG</FONT></I><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>), a US$ 302 reclassification adjustment from 
equity to the statement of income would occur. </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>A schedule of expected 
reclassification of cumulative foreign exchange losses recognized in other 
comprehensive income to the statement of income as of June 30, 2016 is set out 
below:</FONT></P>

<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"
align=right><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="8%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" 
align=right><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="8%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" 
align=right><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="7%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" 
align=right><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="9%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" 
align=right><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="12%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" 
align=right><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; 
BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=red 
face=Calibri,sans-serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=PT-BR 
style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=#548dd4 face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>b)</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 7pt" 
face="times new 
roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif>Cash flow hedges involving swap contracts &#8211; Yen x Dollar 
</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>The Company has a cross currency
swap to fix in U.S. dollars the payments related to bonds denominated in 
Japanese yen and does not intend to settle these contracts before the maturity. 
The relationship between the derivative and the bonds was designated for cash 
flow hedge accounting.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>c)</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 7pt" 
face="times new 
roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif>Sensitivity analysis for foreign exchange risk on financial 
instruments</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>A sensitivity analysis is set 
out below, showing the probable scenario for foreign exchange risk on financial 
instruments, computed based on external data along with stressed scenarios (a 
25% and a 50% change in the foreign exchange rates), except for assets and 
liabilities of foreign subsidiaries, when transacted in a currency equivalent to
their respective functional currencies.</FONT></P>
<a name="_bclFooter52"></a><DIV>

style="DISPLAY: none" face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE:
11pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT 
lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif>52</FONT></FONT><FONT

<TD style="HEIGHT: 6pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 
3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="12%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 6pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 
3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="12%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
<TR style="HEIGHT: 45.75pt">
<TD style="HEIGHT: 45.75pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=6>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 
0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras 
sans,sans-serif">(*) On June 30, 2016, the probable scenario was computed based 
on the following risks: R$ x U.S. Dollar - a 4.4% depreciation of the Real/ 
Japanese Yen x U.S. Dollar - a 0.2% depreciation of the Japanese Yen/ Peso x 
U.S. Dollar - a 0.3% depreciation of the Peso / Euro x U.S. Dollar: an 1.2% 
depreciation of the Euro / Pound Sterling x U.S. Dollar: a 3.4% depreciation of 
the Pound Sterling/ Real x Euro - a 3.1 depreciation of the Real / Real x Pound 
Sterling - 0.9% depreciation of the Real. </FONT><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" 
color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-serif">Source: Focus and 
Bloomberg.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt">
<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=top width="100%" colSpan=6>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-serif">(**) A 
portion of the foreign currency exposure is hedged by a cross-currency
swap.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt">
<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="37%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="15%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-

<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-

<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-

<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-

<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-

<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US

<TD style="HEIGHT: 11.25pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="12%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" color=black face="petrobras sans,sans-
serif"></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; 
BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=red 
face=Calibri,sans-serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=#548dd4 face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>31.3.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Interest rate risk 
management</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>The Company considers that 
interest rate risk does not create a significant exposure and therefore, 
preferably does not use derivative financial instruments to manage interest rate
risk, except for specific situations encountered by certain subsidiaries of 
Petrobras.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>31.4.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Credit risk</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Credit risk management in 
Petrobras aims at minimizing risk of not collecting receivables, financial 
deposits or collateral from third parties or financial institutions through 
efficient credit analysis, granting and management based on quantitative and 
qualitative parameters that are appropriate for each market segment in which the
Company operates.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>The commercial credit portfolio 
is broad and diversified and comprises clients from the domestic market and from
foreign markets. Credit granted to financial institutions is related to 
collaterals received, cash surplus invested and derivative financial 
instruments. It is spread among &#8220;investment grade&#8221; international 
banks rated by international rating agencies and Brazilian banks.</FONT></P>
<a name="_bclFooter53"></a><DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=center><FONT 
style="DISPLAY: none" face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE:
11pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT 
lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif>53</FONT></FONT><FONT
face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT style="DISPLAY: none"><FONT lang=PT-BR 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT></FONT><FONT 
face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></P></DIV></DIV>
<HR align=center SIZE=2 width="100%" noShade>
<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&nbsp;</DIV>
&nbsp; <A name="page_54"></A>
<DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 0%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%">
<a name="_bclHeader54"></a><DIV>
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><B><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 14pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>Petr&#243;leo Brasileiro S.A. &#8211; 
Petrobras</FONT></B></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>Notes to the financial statements</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT><I><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"
face=Calibri,sans-serif>(Expressed in millions of US Dollars, unless otherwise 
indicated)</FONT></I></FONT></P>
<DIV style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0in;
BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-RIGHT: 0in">
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0in; MARGIN: 
0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-RIGHT: 0in"><FONT><FONT lang=EN-
US style="FONT-SIZE: 5pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P></DIV></DIV>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>31.5.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Liquidity risk</FONT></B></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 
12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Liquidity
risk is represented by the possibility of a shortage of cash or other financial 
assets in order to settle the Company&#8217;s obligations on the agreed dates 
and is managed by the Company based on policies such as: centralized cash 
management, in order to optimize the level of cash and cash equivalents held and
to reduce working capital; a minimum cash level to ensure that cash needed for 
investments and short-term obligations is met even in adverse market conditions;
increasing the number of investors in the domestic and international markets 
through funding opportunities, preserving a strong presence in the international
capital markets and searching for new funding sources, including new markets and
financial products, as well as funds under the divestment program.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 
12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>During 
2015, the Company used traditional funding sources (export credit agencies 
&#8211; ECAs, banking market, capital markets and development banks) to obtain 
the necessary funding to repay debt and fund its capital expenditures. In the 
first half of 2016, the Company raised approximately US$&nbsp;8 billion through 
proceeds from long-term financing (mainly international capital market), of 
which US$ 5.98 billion were used to repurchase global notes previously 
issued.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 
12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>A term 
sheet signed in first quarter of 2016 with the China Development Bank CDB to 
obtain US$ 10 billion through financing agreements is still being 
negotiated.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>A maturity schedule of the 
Company&#8217;s finance debt (undiscounted), including face value and interest 
payments is set out following:</FONT></P>

<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"

<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"

<TD style="HEIGHT: 12.75pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-
LEFT: 3pt; PADDING-RIGHT: 3pt" vAlign=bottom width="12%">
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: right; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" 
align=right><FONT style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt" color=black face=arial,sans-
serif></FONT>&nbsp;</P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; 
BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=red 
face=Calibri,sans-serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=#548dd4 face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 13pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>32.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 7pt"
face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 13pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif>Fair value of financial assets and liabilities</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Fair values are determined based
on market </FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" color=black 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>prices</FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>, when available, or, in the absence thereof, on the 
present value of expected future cash flows. The fair values of cash and cash 
equivalents, short term debt and other non-current assets and liabilities are 
equivalent or do not differ significantly from their carrying 
amounts.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>The hierarchy of the fair values
of the financial assets and liabilities, recorded on a recurring basis, is set 
out below:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt 14.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
-14.2pt"><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>-
</FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 7pt" face="times new 
roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-
SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Level 1: inputs are quoted prices 
(unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities that the 
entity can access at the measurement date.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt 14.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
-14.2pt"><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>-
</FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 7pt" face="times new 
roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-
SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Level 2: inputs are inputs other than quoted
prices included within Level 1 that are observable for the asset or liability, 
either directly or indirectly.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt 14.2pt; TEXT-INDENT: 
-14.2pt"><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>-
</FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 7pt" face="times new 
roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-
SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Level 3: inputs are unobservable inputs for
the asset or liability.</FONT></P>
<a name="_bclFooter54"></a><DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=center><FONT 
style="DISPLAY: none" face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE:
11pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT 
lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif>54</FONT></FONT><FONT
face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT style="DISPLAY: none"><FONT lang=PT-BR 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT></FONT><FONT 
face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></P></DIV></DIV>

<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; 
BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=red

<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none"><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" color=#548dd4 face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>There are no material transfers 
between levels.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" color=black face=Calibri,sans-serif>T</FONT><FONT 
lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>he estimated fair 
</FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" color=black face=Calibri,sans-
serif>value for the Company&#8217;s long term debt as of June 30, 2016, computed
based on the </FONT><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif>prevailing market rates is set out in note 16.1.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 13pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>33.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 7pt"
face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 13pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif>Subsequent events</FONT></B></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>33.1.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Global notes issued in 
international capital markets</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>On July 13, 2016, the Company,
through its subsidiary Petrobras Global Trading &#8211; PGF, completed the US$3 
billion bond sale on the international capital markets (global notes), of which 
US$1.75 billion will mature in 5 years and US$1.25 billion will mature in 10 
years. This sale constituted a reopening of a series of securities maturing in 
2021 and 2026, originally issued&nbsp;on May 23,&nbsp;2016, in the amount of US$
6.75 billion.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>The Company used the net 
proceeds from this sale to repurchase global notes previously issued, maturing 
from February 3, 2017 to March 15, 2019, and for corporate purposes in 
general.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>33.2.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Disposal of distribution assets 
in Chile</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>On July 22, 2016, the Company 
signed a sale and purchase agreement with the Southern Cross Group for 100% of 
Petrobras Chile Distribuici&#243;n Ltda (PCD), held through Petrobras Caribe 
Ltda.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>The estimated proceed from this 
deal is US$&nbsp;464, considering amounts from distribution of cash surplus 
before the transaction closing, payments to be made by Southern Cross in the 
closing day and estimated price adjustments within 65 working days after the 
closing.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>The deal&#8217;s completion is 
subject to certain precedent conditions, as established in the agreement and 
customary for this kind of operation, expected to occur in up to three or four 
months.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>33.3.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Disposal of Petrobras 
Argentina</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>On July 27, 2016, the Company 
concluded the disposal of its entire 67.19% interest in Petrobras Argentina 
(PESA), owned through the subsidiary Petrobras Participaciones S.L. 
(&#8220;PPSL&#8221;), to Pampa Energia in amount of US$ 897. This amount is 
still subject to adjustments.</FONT></P>
<a name="_bclFooter55"></a><DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=center><FONT 
style="DISPLAY: none" face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE:
11pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT 
lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif>55</FONT></FONT><FONT
face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT style="DISPLAY: none"><FONT lang=PT-BR 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT></FONT><FONT 
face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></P></DIV></DIV>
<HR align=center SIZE=2 width="100%" noShade>
<DIV style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always">&nbsp;</DIV>
&nbsp; <A name="page_56"></A>
<DIV style="PADDING-LEFT: 0%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%">
<a name="_bclHeader56"></a><DIV>
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><B><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 14pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>Petr&#243;leo Brasileiro S.A. &#8211; 
Petrobras</FONT></B></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>Notes to the financial statements</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><FONT><I><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"
face=Calibri,sans-serif>(Expressed in millions of US Dollars, unless otherwise 
indicated)</FONT></I></FONT></P>
<DIV style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0in; 
BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-RIGHT: 0in">
<P style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: 
medium none; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; PADDING-TOP: 0in; PADDING-LEFT: 0in; MARGIN: 
0in 0in 0pt; BORDER-LEFT: medium none; PADDING-RIGHT: 0in"><FONT><FONT lang=EN-
US style="FONT-SIZE: 5pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif></FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P></DIV></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>As part of this transaction, the
Company intends to acquire 33.6% of the concession of Rio Neuqu&#233;n in 
Argentina and 100% of Colpa Caranda asset in Bolivia for an amount of US$ 52, 
both subject to approvals from PESA&#8217;s Board of Directors and Bolivia 
Federal Government, respectively. </FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>33.4.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Disposal of interest in 
exploratory block BM-S-8</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>On July 28, 2016 the Board of 
Directors of Petrobras approved the disposal of the Company&#8217;s 66% 
interests in the exploratory block BM &#8211; S-8 to Statoil, which includes the
Carar&#225; area located in the pre-sal of Santos Basin, for an amount of 
US$&nbsp;2.5 billion. The other current partners in this block can exercise 
their right of preference in this transaction, allowing them to acquire the 
Company&#8217;s interest by the same amount offered by Statoil, at 
least.</FONT></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 13pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>34.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 7pt"
face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=EN-US style="FONT-SIZE: 13pt" face=Calibri,sans-
serif>Information Related to Guaranteed Securities Issued by 
Subsidiaries</FONT></B></P>
<P style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: avoid; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 12pt 0in 12pt 
28.35pt; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35pt"><B><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" 
face=Calibri,sans-serif>34.1.</FONT></B><B><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 
7pt" face="times new roman">&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT></B><B><FONT lang=PT-BR 
style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Petrobras Global Finance B.V. 
(PGF)</FONT></B></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif>Petr&#243;leo Brasileiro S.A. - 
Petrobras fully and unconditionally guarantees the debt securities issued by 
Petrobras Global Finance B.V. (PGF), a 100-percent-owned finance subsidiary of 
Petrobras. There are no significant restrictions on the ability of Petrobras to 
obtain funds from PGF.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN: 0in 0in 12pt"><FONT lang=EN-US 
style="FONT-SIZE: 3pt" face=Calibri,sans-serif></FONT>&nbsp;</P></DIV>
<a name="_bclFooter56"></a><DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=center><FONT 
style="DISPLAY: none" face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE:
11pt" face=calibri,sans-serif></FONT></FONT><FONT face=calibri,sans-serif><FONT 
lang=PT-BR style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt" face=calibri,sans-serif>56</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=center>&nbsp;</P>

current view and estimates of future economic circumstances, industry 
conditions, company performance and financial results. The words "anticipates", 
"believes", "estimates", "expects", "plans" and similar expressions, as they 
relate to the company, are intended to identify forward-looking statements. 
Statements regarding the declaration or payment of dividends, the implementation
of principal operating and financing strategies and capital expenditure plans, 
the direction of future operations and the factors or trends affecting financial
condition, liquidity or results o f operations are examples of forward-looking 
statements. Such statements reflect the current views of management and are 
subject to a number of risks and uncertainties. There is no guarantee that the 
expected events, trends or results will actually occur. The statements are based

conditions, industry conditions, and operating factors. Any changes in such
